title: Kyiv Links Moscow to Killing of Former Ukrainian Parliament Speaker
description: Ukraine said it had arrested a suspect in the murder of the politician, who had voiced anti-Russian views. The authorities did not explain how the suspect was tied to Moscow.
content:
Ukraine said on Monday that it had arrested a suspect in the murder of a former Ukrainian parliamentary speaker, accusing Moscow of involvement in one of the most high-profile killings since the war began.

“We know that this crime was not accidental. There is a Russian trace in it,” Ukraine’s police chief, Ivan Vyhivskyi, said in a statement that included a blurred photo of the suspect taken during his arrest. The police did not identify him or disclose a motive, and they did not explain or provide evidence for why they believed he was linked to Russia.

Mr. Vyhivskyi said the suspect had carefully prepared the attack, disguising himself as a delivery worker before opening fire on the Ukrainian politician, Andriy Parubiy, in broad daylight on a street in the western city of Lviv. “Eight shots. Coldblooded cruelty,” Mr. Vyhivskyi said.

After the attack, the statement added, the suspect “changed clothes, got rid of the weapon” and hid in the western Khmelnytskyi region, which borders the Lviv region. He was found by the police after a 36- hour manhunt.
summary: Ukraine has arrested a suspect in the murder of Andriy Parubiy, a former Ukrainian parliamentary speaker, and has accused Russia of involvement in the crime. The suspect, who was not identified, hid in the western Khmelnytskyi region after the attack and subsequent disappearance, was found after a 36-hour manhunt. The police have not disclosed a motive for the arrest.
shortSummary: Ukraine arrested a suspect for the murder of former parliament speaker Andriy Parubiy, alleging Russian involvement, but provided no details.
argos_summary: Ukraine arrested a suspect in the murder of former parliamentary speaker Andriy Parubiy, accusing Moscow of involvement. Police say the suspect, disguised as a delivery worker, carried out a premeditated attack in Lviv and fled to Khmelnytskyi before being captured after a 36‑hour manhunt. The police have not disclosed motive or evidence linking the suspect to Russia.
